meanings.definition: a formal indication of a choice between two or more candidates or courses of action, expressed typically through a ballot or a show of hands
meanings.sent1: During the school election, each student cast a vote for their favorite candidate.
meanings.sent2: The citizens will gather to vote for the new mayor next week.
meanings.sent3: In the game of pretend politics, the teddy bears held a vote to decide who would be the king of the toy box.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a vote of confidence that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The thunderous applause was a clear vote in favor of the talented singer.

meanings.definition: to express a formal indication of choice between two or more candidates or courses of action
meanings.sent1: I will vote for my favorite singer on the music competition show.
meanings.sent2: People will vote for their preferred candidate in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to vote on whether to have pizza or burgers for dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her actions seemed to vote against her own best interests.
meanings.sent5: The audience's cheers seemed to vote for the underdog team.

meanings.definition: a collective expression of opinion or will by a group of people, typically through a show of hands or a formal process
meanings.sent1: The unanimous vote of the committee approved the new project proposal.
meanings.sent2: The vote of the shareholders determined the future direction of the company.
meanings.sent3: The vote of the penguins decided that fish was the best meal for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The gentle breeze felt like a vote of approval from nature.
meanings.sent5: The loud cheers from the crowd were a powerful vote of support for the team.
